name: Carbon Black App Control
description: This app supports various investigative and containment actions on Carbon Black App Control (formerly Bit9)

actions.description: Validate the API Token by attempting to connect to the Device URL. This action runs a quick query on the device to check the connection and token
actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permission:
  • View files

actions.description: Searches for a particular file across all the endpoints
actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permission:
  • View files

example_values: Test Malware Protection Signature Update Stub

actions.description: Upload a file to a computer
actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permissions:
  • View file uploads
  • Manage uploads of inventoried files
It has been noticed that the default admin account does not have the required permissions to execute this action. Please create a new user with the required permissions for this app.

example_values: File status is changed to upload state successfully

actions.description: List the files available on the controller
actions.verbose: When provided -1 in limit parameter, it will return the count of the number of files available.

limit.description: Number of records to fetch in each response

actions.description: Get the file from the controller and add it to the vault
actions.verbose: This will only add the file in vault, whose uploadStatus is 3 (Completed).

example_values: Successfully added file to vault. Vault ID: d239545456fbf8e5ff48d8eff7c0f456345d2444

actions.description: Analyze a file on a computer
actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permissions:
  • View files
  • Submit files for analysis

example_values: Analysis status: 0, Analysis status desc: Scheduled

actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permissions:
  • View files
  • Manage files
Sets the global state of the hash to either approved or unapproved by updating the file rule. If the action does not find a rule for the hash, it will return an error. If the hash rule found by the action does not contain a description containing a matching SOAR Identification ID, it will return an error status without changing the state of the rule. This is to make sure the app only modifies rules that have been created or updated by itself.

This action requires the following permissions:
  • View files
  • Manage files
Sets the global state of the file hash to ban by adding or updating a file rule. If a file is found in the catalog, the action will use the catalog id in the rule. The action also appends the SOAR Installation ID to the description of the rule. This is the action's way of tagging rules that are created by the app. If the action finds the current state of the file as banned it does not attempt to set the state, this also results in the description of the rule remaining unchanged.

comment.description: Description to add to the block rule

actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permission:
  • View computers

ip_hostname.description: Hostname/IP address to get info of

actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permission:
  • View files

filecatalog_id.description: Id of fileCatalog associated with this file instance

computer_id.description: Id of computer associated with this file instance

actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permission:
  • View files
  • Change local state

Note that changed local state might not be reflected in the object immediately, but only after agent reports new state.

example_values: Local state of file instance updated successfully

actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permission:
  • View Computers
  • Manage Computers
The policyID is ignored if either localApproval is True or automaticPolicy is True.

example_values: Test Server 2008 R2 x64 Server Standard Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601)
Agent did not receive all the rules yet

actions.verbose:
This action requires the following permissions:
  • View policies

When limit is set to '0' or not set then all the policies will be returned. If set to '-1' then only the result count will be returned, without actual results.

limit.description: Number of records to fetch in each response
